commitResults.messageBody:
Add features for Level-1 of Duke as specified in the project
requirements.

Let's
 * Make the program start by greeting the user
 * Make the program echo commands entered by the user
 * Make the program exit when the user types 'bye'

See below for more details:
https://nus-cs2103-ay2021s1.github.io/website/admin/ip-w2.html

commitResults.messageTitle: Read Commands: Use switch-case statements instead of if-else
commitResults.messageBody:
Program uses if-else statements to read commands.

Adding more commands in the future will make the code less readable.

Let's use switch-case statements instead to make future code more
readable.

Program echos all user input except 'bye'.

Program should store user input and echo them when the command 'list' is
 used.

Let's
 * Make the program store all user input that is not 'list' or 'bye'
 * Make the program list all previous entries when 'list' is used

See below for more details:
https://nus-cs2103-ay2021s1.github.io/website/admin/ip-w2.html

Program stores all tasks as Strings.

Tasks should be represented as a separate object so that more
information can be stored within each task.

Let's
 * Create a Task object to represent individual tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Replace string based tasks with task object
commitResults.messageBody:
Program stores all tasks as strings.

Tasks should be represented with the task object so that more
information can be stored within each task.

Let's
 * Update Duke.java to use the Task object to represent individual tasks

Program does not allow tasks to be marked as done.

Program should store new tasks as 'not done' and provide users with the
ability to mark tasks as done with the 'done id' command, where id is
the task number.

Let's
 * Make the program mark tasks as done with the 'done' command

See below for more details:
https://nus-cs2103-ay2021s1.github.io/website/admin/ip-w2.html

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Deadline, Event and Todo classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Program only has one type of task.

Program should be able to support deadline, event and todo tasks in
order to fulfil Level-4 requirements.

Let's create classes for each type of task and convert Task.java to an
abstract class.

Program only has one type of task.

Program should be able to create different types of tasks that take in
different parameters in order to fulfil Level-4 requirements. Deadline,
Event and ToDo tasks should be supported.

Let's
 * Make the program create a Deadline task with the 'deadline dueTime'
 command, where dueTime is the time that the task is due
 * Make the program create an Event task with the 'event startTime'
 command, where startTime is the time that the event will start
 * Make the program create a ToDo task with the 'todo' command

See below for more details:
https://nus-cs2103-ay2021s1.github.io/website/admin/ip-w2.html

Fix a bug where the list command crashes the program when the list is
empty. Empty lists will now show the message "You have no tasks!"

Program currently needs all commands to be tested manually after a new
command is added.

Let's add automated text ui testing using I/O redirection.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor task classes to use static factory methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Program uses public constructors to create new tasks.

Program should be able to perform a series of checks before the creation
 of a new task object. These checks should be self-contained in order to
  improve code readability.

Let's
* Modify the task classes to use static factory methods instead of
public constructors.
* Change access modifier of the Task constructor to protected
* Change access modifiers of ToDo, Event and Deadline to private

Program has minimal error handling.

Program should be able to perform checks before creating different types
 of tasks and throw an exception if there are any errors.

Let's
* Create a custom exception class called DukeException
* Wrap main loop of the program in a try-catch block
* Throw exceptions from static factory methods and other helper methods
that may be called in the switch-case block

See below for more details:
https://nus-cs2103-ay2021s1.github.io/website/admin/ip-w2.html

Program does not allow tasks to be deleted.

Program should provide users with the ability to delete tasks with the
'delete id' command, where id is the task number.

Let's
* Make the program delete tasks with the 'delete' command
* Update the necessary tests

Main switch-case statement uses case-insensitive strings to represent
each command.

Let's represent different commands with enums to make commands case
insensitive and make code cleaner.

Program is supposed to be a task manager but does not save information
after each session.

Let's
 * Implement a storage class that creates a file to store information
 if it does not already exist.
 * Allow the storage class to append new information to the file
 whenever required.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow tasks to be read from storage
commitResults.messageBody:
Program is supposed to be a task manager but does not save information
after each session.

Let's allow the program to create ToDo, Event and Deadline tasks from
the data in local storage

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow tasks to be saved to storage
commitResults.messageBody:
Program is supposed to be a task manager but does not save information
after each session.

Let's allow the program to save ToDo, Event and Deadline tasks to local
storage.

Program is supposed to be a task manager but local storage does not
support marking tasks as done and deleting tasks.

Let's
 * Allow the program to mark ToDo, Event and Deadline tasks as done in
 local storage
 * Allow the program to delete ToDo, Event and Deadline tasks from local
  storage

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to parse date and time
commitResults.messageBody:
Program saves event and deadline task's date and time as a string. This
prevents the program from performing more advanced operations on the
tasks such as searching by date.

Let's allow the program to parse and store the date and time of events
and deadlines using the yyyy-MM-dd[ HH[:]mm] format, where the square
brackets represent optional parameters.

Program parses and stores dates for Event and Deadline tasks.

There is however no way to filter tasks based on the date they are due.

Let's add a date command which takes in a date in the form yyyy-MM-dd as
 its argument and returns a list of tasks due on that day.

Program currently has the task list and it's operations in Duke.java.

This clutters up Duke.java and may violate certain OOP principles.

Let's extract the TaskList and all related operations to TaskList.java
and change the code in Duke.java accordingly.

All UI related operations are performed in Duke.java.

This clutters up Duke.java and may violate certain OOP principles.

Let's extract all UI related operations to UI.java and change the code
in Duke.java accordingly.

Codebase does not adhere to OOP standards.

The codebase should be modified to make it easier to manage and to
reduce the likelihood of errors in the future.

Let's:
 * Create UI, Parser, Storage classes to handle different operations
 * Create an abstract Command class with a subclass for each command

Files in codebase are not organized.

The class files should be put into different packages to make the
codebase more organized.

Let's put all files into a duke package and create a duke.command
package for command related classes and duke.task for task related
classes.

Certain exception messages were altered during refactoring.

Let's revert these modified exception messages back to their original
form.

Codebase currently does not have any tests to test the behavior of the
code.

Let's add JUnit tests to test the exceptions thrown during the creation
of new ToDo, Event and Deadline tasks

Codebase does not contain any form of documentation.

This makes it difficult for people unfamiliar with the codebase to
understand what different methods do.

Let's add some JavaDocs to make document the actions of different public
 methods.

Codebase does not adhere to all coding style guidelines

Let's modify the code such that it adheres to these guidelines.

Program currently does not support filtering tasks by a string.

This makes it harder to find tasks once the task list gets long.

Let's add a find command that allows users to search for a task with a
keyword.

Merge of branch-A-JavaDoc, branch-A-CheckStyle and branch-A-Level-9
introduced a few issues with the code.

Let's
 * Fix a typo in DateCommand.execute JavaDoc
 * Fix an issue with access modifier in Task.java
 * Fix a missing import statement in Parser.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Update JavaDoc to include header comments
commitResults.messageBody:
Classes do not have header comments.

This makes it difficult for users to find out the purpose of each class
file.

Let's update the JavaDocs such that they include header comments.

Project requires users to manually execute JUnit tests, cleanups,
and builds.

This is time consuming.

Let's use gradle to automate the tasks above.

Checkstyle version in build.gradle was 8.23.

This is incompatible with the version of the checkstyle file provided.

Let's update the checkstyle version to 8.32.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit code to comply with checkstyle v8.32
commitResults.messageBody:
Checkstyle highlights multiple violations of coding standards.

This is not good coding practice and the code will look inconsistent.

Let's fix these violations to make the code look more consistent.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Duke.java to use public constructor
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke.java currently uses a static factory method.

This might not be compatible with the initial set up of Java FX.

Let's replace the static factory method in Duke.java with a public
constructor and make the necessary changes in preparation for Level-10.
